sections.title: Context & Role in Aegis IAM Operations
sections.goal: Establish the interviewee’s responsibilities, daily operational scope, and familiarity with Aegis IAM artifacts and policies.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your primary responsibilities in operating Aegis IAM?
Which runbooks or RFCs do you refer to most frequently, and why?
How do you ensure alignment with POL-SEC-001 in day-to-day activities?

sections.title: Security Controls & Least Privilege Implementation
sections.goal: Assess how least privilege and JIT access are enforced, monitored, and audited in the IAM environment.
sample_questions: Describe your process for granting and revoking JIT access under RB-IAM-075.
What monitoring or alerting mechanisms are in place for privilege escalations?
How do you validate that RBAC configurations remain compliant over time?

sections.title: Incident Handling & Evidence Collection
sections.goal: Understand how the interviewee manages incidents, collects evidence, and maintains compliance during security events.
sample_questions: Can you detail a recent incident where you had to execute RB-IAM-075, including evidence collection?
How do you ensure incident timelines and actions are properly documented for audits?
What challenges have you faced in correlating IAM logs with other subsystems?

sections.title: Cross-Project Dependencies & Risk Management
sections.goal: Explore dependencies between Aegis IAM and other Novereon projects, and how those influence security posture.
sample_questions: How does Aegis IAM integrate with Orion Edge Gateway’s auth mechanisms?
Have you encountered conflicting requirements between IAM and Poseidon Networking policies?
What is your approach to mitigating shared risks across dependent services?

sections.title: Decision-Making & Tradeoffs in Security Controls
sections.goal: Evaluate the interviewee’s ability to make informed tradeoffs between security, usability, and operational efficiency.
sample_questions: Describe a decision where you had to balance strict least privilege against user productivity.
What evidence did you gather to support that decision (e.g., AUD-24-Q2, SLA metrics)?
If you had to revise that decision today, what would you change and why?
